page.title: 12RHOS BREAKWATER
page.content: The{Breakwater}was designed to stop Rhos flooding.It is made mainly of {sandstone}with some{granite.}The majority of the stone comes from quarries in the Ruthin and Denbigh area,though some is from the Penmaen Quarry on Anglesey.The contractors hoped to build the breakwater in 13 weeks but it took nearly a year to complete at a cost of{Â£996 000. There has not been any flooding in Rhos since the completion of the breakwater,though it has yet to prove itself against a combination of a {spring tide}and storms from the{N.E. The breakwater now provides a sheltered{harbour}for a number of small leisure craft and so has added to the facilities available for holiday-makers.The vast majority of people questioned approved of both the effect and look of the breakwater.
